summary: Email correspondence between attorneys and a U.S. Attorney's office regarding scheduling interviews for two clients who report being assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004. The emails discuss travel arrangements and video conference logistics for the interviews.

persons.name: Teri Gibbs
persons.context: Attorney communicating with the U.S. Attorney's office to schedule interviews for two clients who are victims of Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Arick Fudali
persons.context: New York attorney who will accompany one of the victims during her interview with the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Lisa Bloom
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email correspondence regarding victim reports against Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Colleen Mullen
persons.context: Recipient of the email from Teri Gibbs regarding victim reports, likely a prosecutor or official in the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Alison
persons.context: Assistant United States Attorney from the Southern District of New York who proposed meeting times for victim interviews.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (19 Cr. 490 (RMB)); individuals report being assaulted by him.

connections.description: Both are attorneys working together on representing victims in the Epstein case.

events.title: Alleged Assaults by Epstein
events.description: Two individuals report being assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.

events.title: Scheduled Victim Interview
events.description: Scheduled in-person interview at 12 p.m. with one victim at the U.S. Attorney's office, accompanied by attorney Arick Fudali.

events.title: Scheduled Video Conference Interview
events.description: Scheduled video conference interview at 5 p.m. EST with another victim, with attorneys present.

locations: One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Two individuals report being assaulted by Jeffrey Epstein in or around June 2004.
Attorneys are scheduling interviews for these victims with the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York in August 2019.
The correspondence references photographs of the victims from 2004 that were attached for review to see if they appear in photos seized from Epstein's home.
The case referenced is U.S. v. Jeffrey Epstein, 19 Cr. 490 (RMB).
Travel arrangements and video conference logistics are being coordinated for the victim interviews.
